intro: Plagianthera affinis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Plagianthera affinis is adapted to harsh environments, demonstrating resilience to drought and high temperatures.
